section.name: How to generate documentation for my module
section.p:
In order to let maven deal with your documentaion of your module, you have to obey a few things.
Maven 2 allows you to use three different documentation formats in order to set up your documentation.

ul.li: XDOCS - A full description can be found here.
APT - A full description can be found here.
FML - A full description can be found here.

section.p: In the following sections we will give a brief documentation of how to set up the documentation for your module using the different formats mentioned above.

subsection.name: Generate Documentation using XDOCS
subsection.p: In order to write a documentation using XDOC technology repeat the following steps.

ol.li: Create a file myDocu.xml and place it in the directory created above.

Paste this source section into it and customize it. My Name My Page Title Any HTML tags can go anywhere between the body tags.
This text is the text for the first section. This is the text for the first subsection
This text is the text for the second section. This is the text for the first subsection
This text is the text for the third section. Anything within this tag is rendered as a "box"
The example page can be viewed here.
Go to the command line of your module and type mvn site
Maven will generate the page and place it in the directory ${myModule.BaseDir}/target/site/myDocu.html

subsection.p: A full description can be found at the Jakarta Site.

subsection.name: Generate Documentation using APT
subsection.p: In order to write a documentation using APT technology repeat the following steps.

ol.li: Create a file myDocu.apt and place it in the directory created above.

Paste this source section into it and customize it.
------ Title ------ Author ------ Date
Paragraph 1, line 1. Paragraph 1, line 2.
Paragraph 2, line 1. Paragraph 2, line 2.
Section title
* Sub-section title
** Sub-sub-section title
*** Sub-sub-sub-section title
**** Sub-sub-sub-sub-section title
* List item 1.
* List item 2.
Paragraph contained in list item 2.
* Sub-list item 1.
* Sub-list item 2.
* List item 3. Force end of list:
[]
+------------------------------------------+ Verbatim text not contained in list item 3 +------------------------------------------+
[[1]] Numbered item 1.
[[A]] Numbered item A.
[[B]] Numbered item B.
[[2]] Numbered item 2.
List numbering schemes: [[1]], [[a]], [[A]], [[i]], [[I]].
[Defined term 1] of definition list.
[Defined term 2] of definition list.
+-------------------------------+ Verbatim text in a box +-------------------------------+
--- instead of +-- suppresses the box around verbatim text.
[Figure name] Figure caption
*----------*--------------+----------------: | Centered | Left-aligned | Right-aligned | | cell 1,1 | cell 1,2 | cell 1,3 | *----------*--------------+----------------: | cell 2,1 | cell 2,2 | cell 2,3 | *----------*--------------+----------------: Table caption
No grid, no caption:
*-----*------* cell | cell *-----*------* cell | cell *-----*------*
Horizontal line:
=======================================================================
^L New page.
<Italic> font. <<Bold>> font. <<<Monospaced>>> font.
{Anchor}. Link to {{anchor}}. Link to {{http://www.pixware.fr}}. Link to {{{anchor}showing alternate text}}. Link to {{{http://www.pixware.fr}Pixware home page}}.
Force line\ break.
Non\ breaking\ space.
Escaped special characters: \~, \=, \-, \+, \*, \[, \], \<, \>, \{, \}, \\.
Copyright symbol: \251, \xA9, \u00a9.
~~Commented out.
The example page can be viewed here.
Go to the command line of your module and type mvn site
Maven will generate the page and place it in the directory ${myModule.BaseDir}/target/site/myDocu.html

subsection.p: A full description can be found in the maven mini guides section.

subsection.name: Generate Documentation using FML
subsection.p: The FML format is only useful if you want to generate a Frequently Asked Question page or a similar page. This format offers you to place all questions at the top of the page and linking it to the answers, listed below. In order to write a documentation using FML technology repeat the following steps.

ol.li: Create a file myDocu.fml and place it in the directory created above.

Paste this source section into it and customize it. My First Question

My first answer. Any HTML Code can go here. But careful, it must be XHTML compatible. So do not forget the closing tag!

Like this horizontal rule for instance.

My second question

My second answer. If you want to include source fragments, use The source tags My source fragment

My third question

My third answer.

The example page can be viewed here.
Go to the command line of your module and type mvn site
Maven will generate the page and place it in the directory ${myModule.BaseDir}/target/site/myDocu.html

subsection.p: A full description can be found at the Maven 1.x Plugin Site.
